title: Mice in Bion-M 1 Space Mission: Training and Selection
authors: Alexander Andreev-Andrievskiy, Anfisa Popova, Richard Boyle, Jeffrey Alberts, Boris Shenkman, Olga Vinogradova, Oleg Dolgov, Konstantin Anokhin, Darya Tsvirkun, Pavel Soldatov, Tatyana Nemirovskaya, Eugeniy Ilyin, Vladimir Sychev
keywords: Bion-M 1, biosatellite, spaceflight, biomedical research, microgravity, weightlessness, mouse, Mus musculus, C57/BL6, male mice, physiological systems, adaptation, re-adaptation, post-flight recovery, cellular mechanisms, molecular mechanisms, in vivo measurements, in vitro studies, ground control, vivarium control, group housing, telemetry, continuous blood pressure, behavioral tests, mouse training, selection program, cardiovascular system, sensorimotor system, muscle, bone, nervous system, immune system, neuroendocrine system, tissue harvesting, gene expression, specific pathogen-free (SPF) mice.
